message.description: Sends the bridged message as text to the channel.
pros: Easiest to implement, therefore most reliable.
Receives updates much faster than other methods.
Can be edited through the bridge.
cons: Does not feel like the real message
Doesn't support certain features like attachments.

embed.description: Sends the bridged message as an embed to the channel.
pros: Can be edited through the bridge.
Users can customize how their messages appear through the bridge.
cons: Does not feel like the real message
Can be abused to fill up the chat.

webhook.description: Uses a webhook to send the bridged message to the channel.
pros: The bridged message looks most like the real message.
Supports uploaded attachments, embeds, and images.
Maintains user nicknames and avatar images.
cons: Cannot be edited through the bridge.
Uses more API calls and therefore could be a premium-only feature.

image.description: Uses images to retain the look of the original channel message.
pros: Maintains user nicknames and avatar images.
Can be edited through the bridge.
cons: Much more resource heavy than other methods, therefore could be a premium-only feature.
